main_definition: Stars refer to celestial bodies that emit light due to nuclear reactions in their cores, as well as the twinkling objects seen in the night sky.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who is admired or famous
meanings_and_examples.example: She was one of the top stars of Hollywood during her prime.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Parts in a play, movie, or television show that are not spoken dialogue but are performed by actors
meanings_and_examples.example: The choreographed dance sequence is an essential part of this musical's performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A designation given to certain products considered superior in quality or performance
meanings_and_examples.example: This brand offers a range of top-tier stars for outdoor camping equipment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The most luminous and important entities within a particular group, category, or system
meanings_and_examples.example: Among the planets in our solar system, only five are considered major stars due to their gravitational influence on other celestinas.
